title: OnZen
author: OnZen
content: I was not ready to post this. But a few days ago I saw that shahzadafzal sir made a post on this topic in meta which is only for apple users. According to me bitcointalk users are mostly android users and I am one too. I saw this type of post by shahzadafzal sir  and it made me want to use it on android and I am able to do it. I am presenting my small effort in all this. Hope everyone will like it.    What images you will use in your app is your personal matter. Here I have used this image... https://i.ibb.co/KFQDt3g/Screenshot-20230129-200453.jpgFirst of all you have to go to this website. I am presenting everything to be done through the medium of pictures one after the other.Appilix                                                                     Click on build app .. It will take some time please wait for it .           Thank you everyone one . I try to do my best hope everyone will like..

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: It's not a new trick. There are a few alternative of the site you mentioned, which offer converting a website into an app. Have you used the app? Can you share your experience so that interested user know whether it is comfortable or not.Also, what about security? Is it confirmed that they aren't keeping the log of password?

comments.author: Pandorak
comments.body: Nice trick and (maybe) useful for some people in this forum, but have you seen the FAQ posted on the Appilix website?QuoteCan I use the Free version always?Free version is only for preview and testing. You can use it only for few days and will be deactivated if you do not purchase a premium subscription.Due to restrictions for the free version/trial, this trick is completely useless, no need to make things complicated, we can easily access the forum via mainstream browsers such as Chrome, Firefox and Safari.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Not a convenient alternative IMO considering the security of installing an app. The one you linked is a guide to make an easier access in iOS users. While you can just click the "Add to home screen" feature of most browser to make it easier to access the forum on your android phones.
